label: cascading_failure_01_dx_storage_capacity_023
content:
## 2026-01-24 Daily Operations Summary

### Infrastructure
- Stor-a-16
  - CPU Percentage: 94
  - Memory Percentage: 89
  - Disk Used Percentage: 99
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 99
  - Network In Gbps: 11.0
  - Network Out Gbps: 9.6
  - IO Wait Percentage: 17.0
- Stor-b-04
  - CPU Percentage: 76
  - Memory Percentage: 79
  - Disk Used Percentage: 97
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 95
  - Network In Gbps: 8.1
  - Network Out Gbps: 7.4
  - IO Wait Percentage: 11.5
- Stor-c-23
  - CPU Percentage: 68
  - Memory Percentage: 75
  - Disk Used Percentage: 96
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 90
  - Network In Gbps: 6.9
  - Network Out Gbps: 6.2
  - IO Wait Percentage: 8.6
- Meta-01
  - CPU Percentage: 79
  - Memory Percentage: 95
  - Disk Used Percentage: 89
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 80
  - Network In Gbps: 4.5
  - Network Out Gbps: 3.8
  - IO Wait Percentage: 7.0

### Events
- Another heavy ingest day (+238 TB) pushed overall utilization above 89% and drove quota hard blocks to 6; enforced immediate freeze on new tenant onboarding.
- Compaction pending jumped to 130 with disk busy p95 94.6%; scheduled extended overnight compaction and reduced rebalance bandwidth during peak.
- Scrub errors rose to 44; identified top churn namespaces and requested workload changes (lower TTL churn, batch deletes) to reduce tombstone load.
- Metadata manifest backlog climbed to 6.1k; temporarily disabled non-critical namespace inventory jobs and increased metadata write buffers.

### On Call
- Shift: Nisha P. 
- Pages: 12 
- Tickets: 21 
- Status: Degraded; capacity constraints and high churn workloads are stressing compaction/scrubs and triggering quotas. 
- Mitigations: onboarding freeze, workload adjustments, overnight compaction, metadata job deferrals.
